titleStmt.title: A plea to an appeale trauersed dialogue wise. By H.B.
titleStmt.author: Burton, Henry, 1578-1648.

editionStmt.edition: This text is an enriched version of the TCP digital transcription A17306 of text S106969 in the English Short Title Catalog (STC 4153). Textual changes and metadata enrichments aim at making the text more computationally tractable, easier to read, and suitable for network-based collaborative curation by amateur and professional end users from many walks of life. The text has been tokenized and linguistically annotated with MorphAdorner. The annotation includes standard spellings that support the display of a text in a standardized format that preserves archaic forms ('loveth', 'seekest'). Textual changes aim at restoring the text the author or stationer meant to publish.

respStmt.resp: This text has not been fully proofread

fileDesc.extent: Approx. 268 KB of XML-encoded text transcribed from 61 1-bit group-IV TIFF page images.

publicationStmt.pubPlace: Evanston,IL, Notre Dame, IN, St. Louis, MO

availability.p: This keyboarded and encoded edition of the work described above is co-owned by the institutions providing financial support to the Early English Books Online Text Creation Partnership. This Phase I text is available for reuse, according to the terms of Creative Commons 0 1.0 Universal . The text can be copied, modified, distributed and performed, even for commercial purposes, all without asking permission.

titleStmt.title: A plea to an appeale trauersed dialogue wise. By H.B.
titleStmt.author: Burton, Henry, 1578-1648.

notesStmt.note: A reply to: Montagu, Richard. Appello Caesarem.
This edition has errata on A4r and N3r; the heart in the title page woodcut is upside-down.
Reproduction of the original in Cambridge University Library.
